TopicTitle: How can I make a stock module?

Articles.Content: I want the kerbals to be able to move around in it but I want it fairly roundish and also big with plenty of room. And I want it to be able to dock and spin for a centrifugal effect in weightless ness.

You want some sort of "cage" that they can float and move around in? Or you want a module (like a capsule or lab) that they can "move around in"?

Also, spinning only works out on a short term basis. When you leave the craft or enter non-physical time warp the spinning will stop...
If you're talking like a centrifuge I believe you can do that with animations. You would probably find more help over on the add-on thread

Hitchhiker container for the hub, a few girders for spokes, and structural panels for the rim. Unfortunately I don't think a Kerbal can walk on the inside of a spinning wheel in space, but you might be able to drive a rover on it.

Don't forget to put your Kerbals back inside and dock your rover before timewarping, or they'll drift straight through the wheel and away.

I haven't tried the following myself. But I know of the following mod http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/29031-0-23-5-Hollow-Structures-Hulls-%28Updated-2014-04-09%29

This mod adds internal EVA/IVA pods. Which you can reconnect to one another to create as a massive internal space cabin as you see fit.

It is my idea that if you connect 2 internal pods on each end of a cillinder or long girder segment and make it spin you must theoratically/practically introduce artofficial gravity inside the EVA pods.

Haven't tested this myself. Perhaps you should give this a try.
